lead_paragraph: It has been the year of the backup quarterback and at least three more will get a chance this week. Fifty-six quarterbacks have made starts this season, including the newcomers Brock Berlin (Rams) and Chris Redman (Falcons) in Week 14. Kyle Orton, who has not thrown a regular-season pass since 2005, has already been announced as the Bears’ starter for Monday night’s game against the Vikings. Shaun Hill appears to be the last man standing for the 49ers, and Todd Collins, No. 15 at right, will get the start for the Redskins in place of the injured Jason Campbell. San Francisco and Chicago will become the sixth and seventh teams to use three starting quarterbacks this season.
